config.directions: Move the slider to learn the steps artists take to create an assemblage.

entries.title: Gather materials
entries.content: A variety of objects, found materials, traditional art supplies, and photos are collected. A surface is chosen, like an already developed sculpture, canvas, or wood.
entries.alt: a variety of feathers, buttons, sticks, and a wheel

entries.title: Arrange
entries.content: Artists experiment with arranging the materials until they are satisfied. There are many ways to manipulate materials, like cutting, twisting, crumpling, knotting, and attaching. The options are endless for each artist.
entries.alt: layered paper, weaved yard, and crumpled paper balls

entries.title: Secure
entries.content: Once the artist is satisfied with the arrangement, they securely attach the materials using an adhesive, nails, or other means.
entries.alt: a completed, colorful mixed media artwork

entries.title: Display
entries.content: Once the artwork is finished, artists can mount or present the finished assemblage in a suitable manner for viewing.
entries.alt: a girl standing in front of a textured mixed media artwork
